com.eduworks.ec.framework

Class ScreenManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.eduworks.ec.framework.ViewManager
      • com.eduworks.ec.framework.ScreenManager
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    OverlayManager

    public class ScreenManager
extends ViewManager
    View Manager child class that manages loading "screen"s and saving screen history. This is the main view type in an application and represents a view that takes up (mostly) the entire browser page. History is tracked in the session, so when the back button is pressed, the application will load the previous screen with any data that was associated with it.
    Author:
    devlin.junker@eduworks.com

      static EcScreen startupScreen
      Screen to be set by application if it notices that a certain screen should be loaded on startup that is different from the default Screen

    • Field Detail

      • LOADING_STARTUP_PAGE

        public static final EcScreen LOADING_STARTUP_PAGE
        Screen to be used when another screen is loading information from the server before being able to display itself. Notice that the display function does not affect the DOM on the page in any way.

      • defaultScreen

        public static EcScreen defaultScreen
        Screen to be set by application on application startup, dictates what the screen should be if the startup Screen hasn't been set

      • startupScreen

        public static EcScreen startupScreen
        Screen to be set by application if it notices that a certain screen should be loaded on startup that is different from the default Screen

        public ScreenManager()

    • Method Detail

      • addStartupScreenCallback

        public static void addStartupScreenCallback(org.stjs.javascript.functions.Callback0 callback)
        Function to add startup screen callbacks to the array of callbacks
        Parameters:
        callback - callback to add, all callbacks will be invoked on the application startup

      • getCurrentScreen

        public static EcScreen getCurrentScreen()
        Retrieves the current view that corresponds to the Screen Container Element (Should be a screen)
        Returns:
        EcScreen instance that is currently being shown in the screen container element

      • setDefaultScreen

        public static void setDefaultScreen(EcScreen page)
        Sets the application default Screen that is shown if no startup screen has been defined. Also sets up some code to run during the application load, that calls the startup callbacks to see if there is a startup screen different than the defaultScreen, then displays it or the defaultScreen depending on the results
        Parameters:
        page - The default screen that will be displayed if no startup screen is defined during load

      • changeScreen

        public static void changeScreen(EcScreen page,
                                java.lang.Boolean addHistory,
                                org.stjs.javascript.functions.Callback0 callback)
        Set's the current screen, then show's it by calling the display function. Depending on the addHistory flag, will add the page passed in to the history array, tracking session page history
        Parameters:
        page - The screen to set as current and display
        addHistory - Flag for whether to store this page in the history array
        callback - Function to invoke after the page has been displayed and foundation has been set up on the new HTML

      • replaceScreen

        public static void replaceScreen(EcScreen page,
                                 org.stjs.javascript.functions.Callback0 callback)
        Set's the current screen, then show's it by calling the display function. This replaces the current HistoryClosure element for the current screen in the history array, rather than leaving it and (potentially) adding another history array element like changeScreen
        Parameters:
        page - Screen to set as current and display
        callback - Function to invoke after the page has been displayed and foundation has been set up on the new HTML

      • reloadCurrentScreen

        public static void reloadCurrentScreen(org.stjs.javascript.functions.Callback0 callback)
        Reloads the current screen, leaving the history alone
        Parameters:
        callback - Function to invoke after the page has been redisplayed and foundation has been set up on the new HTML

      • addHistory

        public static void addHistory(EcScreen screen,
                              java.lang.String displayContainerId)
        Adds the screen passed in and the display container to a HistoryClosure element and pushes it on the end of the history cache array. This does not ensure that the screen is displayed though.
        Parameters:
        screen - The screen to add to the history cache array
        displayContainerId - DOM Element ID corresponding to where the screen will be displayed (likely the SCREEN_CONTAINER_ID)

      • replaceHistory

        public static void replaceHistory(EcScreen screen,
                                  java.lang.String displayContainerId,
                                  java.lang.Object params)
        Replaces the current end of the history array with a new HistoryClosure element that contains the screen and containerId passed in. This can also be used to set the url parameters on a page and reload it without adding another history element to the history array
        Parameters:
        screen - Screen to add to the history element that will replace the last in the history array
        displayContainerId - DOM Element ID corresponding to where the screen will be displayed (likely the SCREEN_CONTAINER_ID)
        params - Object containing key to value pairs that should be put in the url bar to remember state at this history point
